cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color used in branding and design is said to have the power to evoke emotions.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding

cluster_relations.rel_desc: An important aspect of color in branding is its ability to evoke specific emotions.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
remarks: Semantically overlaps with an earlier relation but emphasizes specificity; retained for richness.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Warm colors evoke or create a sense of urgency.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when used in branding or marketing visuals

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cool colors create or foster a sense of trust.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when used in branding or marketing visuals

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cool colors create or enhance a sense of reliability.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when used in branding or marketing visuals

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A sense of urgency contributes to or facilitates impulse purchases.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
remarks: Relation inferred from domain logic rather than explicit wording.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color psychology in branding highlights how colors can evoke consumer emotions.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
remarks: Emotions are treated as color-evoked states within the color psychology in branding framework.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject (e.g., a color or color scheme in branding) tends to evoke, elicit, or create a psychological or emotional state in viewers or consumers.
args.justification: All these relations describe how colors or color psychology in branding cause or bring about emotional or psychological states (emotions, trust, reliability, sense of urgency). They share the same direction (stimulus → internal state) and differ only in specific colors or specific emotions.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject psychological state or condition contributes to, supports, or facilitates the occurrence of a specific consumer behavior or action.
args.justification: This relation links a psychological state (sense of urgency) to a downstream behavior (impulse purchases), which is conceptually different from direct emotion-evoking and better captured as facilitating a consumer behavior.
args.remark: Based partly on inferred marketing logic; kept distinct from direct emotion-evoking predicates.

args.justification: These relations all describe how branding-related visual stimuli (colors, color psychology) produce psychological or emotional effects in consumers, fitting a shared class focused on psychological effects of marketing stimuli.

This relation connects an internal psychological state (sense of urgency) to a purchasing behavior (impulse purchases), which is more specifically about consumer behavior outcomes than about immediate emotional effects of stimuli.
All relations express causal or quasi-causal influence: colors or color psychology causing psychological states, and psychological states facilitating consumer behaviors.
